#include "bignum.h"

#define uchar   unsigned char
#define uint   unsigned int
#define ulong   unsigned long int
#define ERR_RSA_KEYGEN_FAILED   0x0300
#define ERR_RSA_PUBLIC_FAILED   0x0320
#define ERR_RSA_PRIVATE_FAILED   0x0340
#define ERR_RSA_KEY_CHECK_FAILED   0x0360
#define ERR_RSA_ENCRYPT_FAILED   0x0380
#define ERR_RSA_DECRYPT_FAILED   0x03A0
#define ERR_RSA_SIGN_FAILED   0x03C0
#define ERR_RSA_VERIFY_FAILED   0x03E0
#define RSA_NONE   0
#define RSA_MD2   2
#define RSA_MD4   3
#define RSA_MD5   4
#define RSA_SHA1   5
#define RSA_SIGN   0x01
#define RSA_CRYPT   0x02
#define ASN1_HASH_MDX
#define ASN1_HASH_SHA1

#define ASN1_HASH_MDX
 

Value:

"\x30\x20\x30\x0C\x06\x08\x2A\x86\x48"  \
    "\x86\xF7\x0D\x02\x00\x05\x00\x04\x10"

#define ASN1_HASH_SHA1
 

Value:

"\x30\x21\x30\x09\x06\x05\x2B\x0E\x03"  \
    "\x02\x1A\x05\x00\x04\x14"

Function Documentation

int rsa_gen_key (  rsa_context *  ctx,
int  nbits,
int  exponent,
ulong(*)(void *)  rng_fn,
void *  rng_st
) 
 

Generate an RSA keypair.

Parameters:
ctx RSA context to be initialized
nbits size of the public key in bits
exponent public exponent (e.g., 65537)
rng_fn points to the RNG function
rng_st points to the RNG state
Returns:
0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_KEYGEN_FAILED

int rsa_pkcs1_decrypt (  rsa_context *  ctx,
uchar *  input,
int  ilen,
uchar *  output,
int *  olen
) 
 

Do a private RSA and remove the PKCS1 v1.5 padding.

Parameters:
ctx RSA context
input buffer holding the encrypted data
ilen must be the same as the modulus size
output buffer that will hold the plaintext
olen size of output buffer, will be updated to contain the length of the plaintext
Returns:
0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_DECRYPT_FAILED

int rsa_pkcs1_encrypt (  rsa_context *  ctx,
uchar *  input,
int  ilen,
uchar *  output,
int  olen
) 
 

Add the PKCS1 v1.5 padding and do a public RSA.

Parameters:
ctx RSA context
input buffer holding the data to be encrypted
ilen length of the plaintext; cannot be longer than the modulus, minus 3+8 for padding
output buffer that will hold the ciphertext
olen must be the same as the modulus size (for example, 128 if RSA-1024 is used)
Returns:
0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_ENCRYPT_FAILED

int rsa_pkcs1_sign (  rsa_context *  ctx,
int  alg_id,
uchar *  hash,
int  hashlen,
uchar *  sig,
int  siglen
) 
 

Perform a private RSA to sign a message digest.

Parameters:
ctx RSA context
alg_id RSA_MD2/4/5, RSA_SHA1 or RSA_NONE
hash buffer holding the message digest
hashlen message digest length (only for RSA_NONE)
sig buffer that will hold the ciphertext
siglen must be the same as the modulus size (for example, 128 if RSA-1024 is used)
Returns:
0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_SIGN_FAILED

int rsa_pkcs1_verify (  rsa_context *  ctx,
int  alg_id,
uchar *  hash,
int  hashlen,
uchar *  sig,
int  siglen
) 
 

Perform a public RSA and check the message digest.

Parameters:
ctx points to an RSA public key
alg_id RSA_MD2/4/5, RSA_SHA1 or RSA_NONE
hash buffer holding the message digest
hashlen message digest length (only for RSA_NONE)
sig buffer holding the ciphertext
siglen must be the same as the modulus size
Returns 0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_VERIFY_FAILED

int rsa_private (  rsa_context *  ctx,
uchar *  input,
int  ilen,
uchar *  output,
int  olen
) 
 

Perform an RSA private key operation.

Returns:
0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_PRIVATE_FAILED
Note:
This function does not take care of message padding: both ilen and olen must be equal to the modulus size (ctx->len). Also, be sure to set input[0] = 0.

int rsa_public (  rsa_context *  ctx,
uchar *  input,
int  ilen,
uchar *  output,
int  olen
) 
 

Perform an RSA public key operation.

Returns:
0 if successful, or ERR_RSA_PUBLIC_FAILED
Note:
This function does not take care of message padding: both ilen and olen must be equal to the modulus size (ctx->len). Also, be sure to set input[0] = 0.

int rsa_self_test (  void   ) 
 

Checkup routine.

Returns:
0 if successful, or 1 if the test failed
